skill.name: Advanced AgentDB Vector Search Implementation
skill.description: Master advanced AgentDB features including QUIC synchronization, multi-database management, custom distance metrics, hybrid search, and distributed systems integration for building distributed AI systems, multi-agent coordination, and advanced vector search applications.
skill.summary: Master advanced AgentDB features including QUIC synchronization, multi-database management, custom d...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation/prompt skill containing only TypeScript code examples and configuration guidance for AgentDB implementation. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution. All examples describe legitimate database configuration procedures.

content.value_statement: Building distributed vector search systems requires complex infrastructure setup. This skill provides a 5-phase implementation guide for AgentDB with QUIC synchronization, custom distance metrics, and production-ready monitoring.
actual_capabilities: Set up multi-database AgentDB cluster with primary and replicas
Configure QUIC synchronization for real-time replication
Implement custom distance metrics for domain-specific similarity
Deploy hybrid search combining vector and traditional methods
Optimize performance with HNSW indexing, caching, and quantization
Configure production monitoring with Prometheus and alerting
limitations: Does not include pre-built AgentDB packages (npm packages must be installed separately)
Requires existing knowledge of vector database concepts
Does not provision actual cloud infrastructure or servers
Does not provide credentials or authentication for external services

use_cases.title: Build vector search systems
use_cases.description: Deploy scalable vector databases for semantic search, recommendation systems, or RAG applications

use_cases.title: Configure production databases
use_cases.description: Set up high-availability database clusters with monitoring, backup, and failover policies

use_cases.title: Implement multi-agent memory
use_cases.description: Create shared memory systems for multi-agent coordination with real-time synchronization

prompt_templates.title: Quick setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a basic AgentDB instance with QUIC synchronization and two replicas following the quick start guide

prompt_templates.title: Custom metric
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a custom distance metric that combines vector cosine similarity with timestamp-based decay for my document search use case

prompt_templates.title: Performance tuning
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure HNSW indexing, query caching, and quantization to achieve 150x faster search with 4x memory reduction

prompt_templates.title: Production deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy an AgentDB cluster to production with monitoring, health checks, alerting, and a complete operational runbook

output_examples.input: Implement a custom hybrid similarity metric for document search
output: Created hybrid-similarity metric combining 70% vector cosine distance with 30% scalar features
Registered metric with AgentDB and validated mathematical properties
Benchmarked accuracy showing 20% improvement over cosine-only search
Stored metric configuration in memory for deployment

best_practices: Validate multi-database consistency by inserting test vectors and verifying replication across all replicas
Benchmark custom metrics against standard metrics (cosine, euclidean) to measure accuracy improvements
Configure health checks and alerting before deploying to production to catch issues early
anti_patterns: Skipping validation steps and deploying without verifying replication lag and consistency
Using default HNSW parameters without tuning for your specific dataset size and accuracy requirements
Deploying without monitoring or alerting, making production issues difficult to detect

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for implementing AgentDB vector search in TypeScript/Node.js projects.

faq.question: What are the performance targets?
faq.answer: Search latency P95 under 10ms, insert throughput over 50000 vectors/sec, and 4x memory compression with quantization.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing systems?
faq.answer: AgentDB provides standard TypeScript APIs for insert, search, and delete operations. Connect via localhost or configured host/port.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill provides configuration guidance only. Actual data safety depends on your deployment choices including encryption and access controls.

faq.question: Why is replication lag high?
faq.answer: Check QUIC stream saturation, network connectivity between nodes, and primary database load. Increase maxStreams if needed.

faq.question: How does this compare to other vector databases?
faq.answer: AgentDB offers integrated QUIC sync and custom metrics out of the box. Other databases may require additional tooling for these features.
